column1: index,quote,name

1,The third-rate mind is only happy when it is thinking with the majority. The second-rate mind is only happy when it is thinking with the minority. The first-rate mind is only happy when it is thinking.,A. A. Milne
2,History teaches us that men and nations behave wisely once they have exhausted all other alternatives.,Abba Eban
3,"How many legs does a dog have, if you call the tail a leg? Four. Calling a tail a leg doesn't make it a leg.",Abraham Lincoln
4,"Nearly all men can stand adversity, but if you want to test a man's character, give him power.",Abraham Lincoln
5,"When I do good, I feel good
column2: when I do bad, I feel bad, and that is my religion.",Abraham Lincoln

column1: 6,Better to remain silent and be thought a fool than to speak out and remove all doubt.,Abraham Lincoln
7,"You can fool some of the people all of the time, and all of the people some of the time, but you can not fool all of the people all of the time.",Abraham Lincoln
8,"To the man who only has a hammer, everything he encounters begins to look like a nail.",Abraham Maslow
9,My definition of a free society is a society where it is safe to be unpopular.,Adlai E. Stevenson Jr.
10,I use emotion for the many and reserve reason for the few.,Adolf Hitler
11,It is always more difficult to fight against faith than against knowledge.,Adolf Hitler
12,"Do not look where you fell, but where you slipped.",African proverb
13,Do you realize if it weren't for Edison we'd be watching TV by candlelight?,Al Boliska
14,Any company large enough to have a research lab is too large to listen to it.,Alan Kay
15,Education is what remains after one has forgotten what one has learned in school.,Albert Einstein
16,Insanity: doing the same thing over and over again and expecting different results.,Albert Einstein
17,Logic will get you from A to B. Imagination will take you everywhere.,Albert Einstein
18,"Not everything that can be counted counts, and not everything that counts can be counted.",Albert Einstein
19,A clever person solves a problem. A wise person avoids it.,Albert Einstein

20,"Imagination is more important than knowledge. For knowledge is limited to all we now know and understand, while imagination embraces the entire world, and all there ever will be to know and understand.",Albert Einstein
21,"When you look at yourself from a universal standpoint, something inside always reminds or informs you that there are bigger and better things to worry about.",Albert Einstein
22,The only thing that interferes with my learning is my education.,Albert Einstein
23,The difference between genius and stupidity is that genius has its limits.,Albert Einstein
24,The person who reads too much and uses his brain too little will fall into lazy habits of thinking.,Albert Einstein
25,Time and space are modes by which we think and not conditions in which we live.,Albert Einstein
26,"When you sit with a nice girl for two hours, you think it's only a minute. But when you sit on a hot stove for a minute, you think it's two hours. That's  relativity.",Albert Einstein
27,"There are people who, instead of listening to what is being said to them, are already listening to what they are going to say themselves.",Albert Guinon
28,"When everyone is against you, it means that you are absolutely wrong-- or absolutely right.",Albert Guinon
29,An intellectual is a person who has discovered something more interesting than sex.,Aldous Huxley
30,"Blessed is he who expects nothing, for he shall never be disappointed.",Alexander Pope
31,Do not confuse motion and progress. A rocking horse keeps moving but does not make any progress.,Alfred A. Montapert
32,It is easier to fight for one's principles than to live up to them.,Alfred Adler
33,The point of quotations is that one can use another's words to be insulting.,Amanda Cross
34,"Acquaintance, n.: A person whom we know well enough to borrow from, but not well enough to lend to.",Ambrose Bierce
35,"Courage is not the absence of fear, but rather the judgement that something else is more important than fear.",Ambrose Redmoon
36,We don't see things as they are. We see things as we are.,Anais Nin
37,It is better to fail at your own life than to succeed at someone else's.,AndrÃ© Gide
38,People cannot discover new lands until they have the courage to lose sight of the shore.,AndrÃ© Gide
39,Believe those who are seeking the truth. Doubt those who find it.,AndrÃ© Gide
40,It is bad luck to be superstitious.,Andrew W. Mathis
41,If the lessons of history teach us anything it is that nobody learns the lessons that history teaches us.,Anon
42,"Perfection is achieved, not when there is nothing more to add, but when there is nothing left to take away.",Antoine de Saint-ExupÃ©ry
43,"What lies in our power to do, lies in our power not to do.",Aristotle
44,It is the mark of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it.,Aristotle
45,"We are what we repeatedly do
column2: excellence, then, is not an act but a habit.",Aristotle

column1: 46,Talent hits a target no one else can hit
column2: Genius hits a target no one else can see.,Arthur Schopenhauer

column1: 47,"All truth passes through three stages. First, it is ridiculed. Second, it is violently opposed. Third, it is accepted as being self-evident.",Arthur Schopenhauer
48,"Every nation ridicules other nations, and all are right.",Arthur Schopenhauer
49,I'd rather live with a good question than a bad answer.,Aryeh Frimer
50,The Argument from Intimidation is a confession of intellectual impotence.,Ayn Rand
51,The real problem is not whether machines think but whether men do.,B. F. Skinner
52,A wise man gets more use from his enemies than a fool from his friends.,Baltasar Gracian
53,"Good judgment comes from experience, and experience comes from bad judgment.",Barry LePatner
54,A government that is big enough to give you all you want is big enough to take it all away.,Thomas Jefferson
55,Do not seek to follow in the footsteps of the men of old
column2: seek what they sought. ,Basho

column1: 56,Trying to determine what is going on in the world by reading newspapers is like trying to tell the time by watching the second hand of a clock.,Ben Hecht
57,"Never apologize for showing feeling. When you do so, you apologize for truth.",Benjamin Disraeli
58,Either write something worth reading or do something worth writing.,Benjamin Franklin
59,The tragedy of life doesn't lie in not reaching your goal. The tragedy lies in having no goals to reach.,Benjamin Mays
60,What happens to the hole when the cheese is gone?,Bertolt Brecht
61,"The whole problem with the world is that fools and fanatics are always so certain of themselves, and wiser people so full of doubts.",Bertrand Russell
62,No one gossips about other people's secret virtues.,Bertrand Russell

63,"If a man is offered a fact which goes against his instincts, he will scrutinize it closely, and unless the evidence is overwhelming, he will refuse to believe it. If, on the other hand, he is offered something which affords a reason for acting in accordance to his instincts, he will accept it even on the slightest evidence. The origin of myths is explained in this way.",Bertrand Russell
64,The greatest challenge to any thinker is stating the problem in a way that will allow a solution.,Bertrand Russell
65,"I don't know the key to success, but the key to failure is trying to please everybody.",Bill Cosby
66,"If at first you don't succeed, find out if the loser gets anything.",Bill Lyon
67,"Thought is useful when it motivates for action, and a hindrance when it substitutes for action.",Bill Raeder
68,An optimist stays up to see the New Year in. A pessimist waits to make sure the old one leaves.,Bill Vaughan
69,"We learn something every day, and lots of times it's that what we learned the day before was wrong.",Bill Vaughan
70,Careful. We don't want to learn from this.,Bill Watterson
71,I really wish I was less of a thinking man and more of a fool not afraid of rejection.,Billy Joel
72,I have made this letter longer than usual because I lack the time to make it shorter.,Blaise Pascal
73,A single question can be more influential than a thousand statements.,Bo Bennett
74,A bank is a place that will lend you money if you can prove that you don't need it.,Bob Hope
75,"The less you know, the more you believe.",Bono
76,When the student is ready the teacher will appear.,Buddhist Proverb
77,"Don't ever wrestle with a pig. You'll both get dirty, but the pig will enjoy it.",Cale Yarborough
78,The most remarkable thing about my mother is that for thirty years she served the family nothing but leftovers. The original meal has never been found. ,Calvin Trillin
79,Everything that irritates us about others can lead us to an understanding of ourselves.,Carl Jung

80,"Just the fact that some geniuses were laughed at does not imply that all who are laughed at are geniuses. They laughed at Columbus, they laughed at Fulton, they laughed at the Wright brothers. But they also laughed at Bozo the Clown.",Carl Sagan
81,"Some people make things happen, some people watch things happen, and some ask what happened.",Casey Stengel
82,"If you can't be a good example, then you'll just have to be a horrible warning.",Catherine Aird
83,You don't get anything clean without getting something else dirty.,Cecil Baxter
84,Happiness is the absence of striving for happiness.,Chang-Tzu
85,"Fight for your opinions, but do not believe that they contain the whole truth, or the only truth.",Charles A. Dana
86,The difference between a democracy and a dictatorship is that in a democracy you vote first and take orders later
column2: in a dictatorship you don't have to waste your time voting.,Charles Bukowski

column1: 87,An inventor is simply a fellow who doesn't take his education too seriously.,Charles F. Kettering
88,"Bureaucrats write memoranda both because they appear to be busy when they are writing and because the memos, once written, immediately become proof that they were busy.",Charles Peters
89,"By the time a man realizes that maybe his father was right, he usually has a son who thinks he's wrong.",Charles Wadsworth
90,"He who asks is a fool for five minutes, but he who does not ask remains a fool forever.",Chinese Proverb
91,One dog barks at something. And a hundred dogs bark at the sound.,Chinese Proverb
92,I hear: I forget / I see: I remember / I do: I understand,Chinese Proverb
93,Asking a working writer what he thinks about critics is like asking a lamppost how it feels about dogs.,Christopher Hampton
94,There is only one success - to be able to spend your life in your own way.,Christopher Morley
95,Inspiration is for amateurs. I just get to work.,Chuck Close
96,"In theory, there is no difference between theory and practice
column2: In practice, there is.",Chuck Reid

column1: 97,When I was a boy I was told that anybody could become President. Now I'm beginning to believe it.,Clarence Darrow
98,Laughing at our mistakes can lengthen our own life. Laughing at someone else's can shorten it.,Cullen Hightower
99,There are many who dare not kill themselves for fear of what the neighbors will say.,Cyril Connolly

126,In God we trust
column2: all others bring data.,Dr. Edwards Deming

column1: 127,"Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter and those who matter don't mind.",Dr. Seuss

column2: genius does what it must.,Edward Bulwer-Lytton

column1: 135,Just because your voice reaches halfway around the world doesn't mean you are wiser than when it reached only to the end of the bar.,Edward R. Murrow
136,The skill of writing is to create a context in which other people can think.,Edwin Schlossberg
137,No one can make you feel inferior without your consent.,Eleanor Roosevelt

138,"Normal is getting dressed in clothes that you buy for work and driving through traffic in a car that you are still paying for - in order to get to the job you need to pay for the clothes and the car, and the house you leave vacant all day so you can afford to live in it.",Ellen Goodman
139,The cure for boredom is curiosity. There is no cure for curiosity.,Ellen Parr

155,"Watch your thoughts
column2: they become words.

column1: Watch your words
column2: they become actions.

column1: Watch your actions
column2: they become habits.

column1: Watch your habits
column2: they become character.

column1: Watch your character
column2: it becomes your destiny. ",Lao Tze

column1: 156,We should be taught not to wait for inspiration to start a thing. Action always generates inspiration. Inspiration seldom generates action.,Frank Tibolt

column1: 216,Only the mediocre are always at their best.,Jean Giraudoux

column2: now I have six children and no theories.,John Wilmot

column1: 238,No wise man ever wished to be younger.,Jonathan Swift

column2: a million deaths is a statistic.,Joseph Stalin
